# This Python 3 environment comes with many helpful analytics libraries installed
# It is defined by the kaggle/python Docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python
# For example, here's several helpful packages to load

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
import plotly.graph_objs as go
import plotly.offline as py
import plotly.express as px

import warnings
warnings.simplefilter(action='ignore', category=FutureWarning)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 20GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All" 
# You can also write temporary files to /kaggle/temp/, but they won't be saved outside of the current session
source.f5db6449:
#Minimum age limit for what? The government prioritized people from this age group to get vaccinated first.

ax = df['min_age_limit'].value_counts().plot.barh(figsize=(10, 6), color='green')
ax.set_title('Minimum Age Limit', size=18, color='orange')
ax.set_ylabel('min_age_limit', size=10)
ax.set_xlabel('Count', size=10);
source.a02792d2:
#Code by Varshini PJ  user: varshinipj

fig = px.scatter_mapbox(teynampet,
# Here, plotly gets, (x,y) coordinates
lat="lat",
lon="long",
text='block_name',

                #Here, plotly detects color of series
                size="available_capacity_dose1",
                color = "allow_all_age",
                labels="block_name",

                zoom=14.5,
                center={"lat":13.044403, "lon":80.251648},
                height=600,
                width=800)
fig.update_layout(mapbox_style='stamen-terrain')
fig.update_layout(margin={"r": 0, "t": 0, "l": 0, "b": 0})
fig.update_layout(title_text="Available first doses in Teynampet")
fig.show()

fig = px.scatter_mapbox(df,
# Here, plotly gets, (x,y) coordinates
lat="lat",
lon="long",
text='vaccine',

                #Here, plotly detects color of series
                size="available_capacity",
                color = "block_name",
                labels="vaccine",

                zoom=6,
                center={"lat":12, "lon":80},
                height=600,
                width=800)
fig.update_layout(mapbox_style='stamen-terrain')
fig.update_layout(margin={"r": 0, "t": 0, "l": 0, "b": 0})
fig.update_layout(title_text="Vaccines Available Capacity in Chennai")
fig.show()

source.3da651db: #This Code was made with the help of Varshini PJ and hers complimentary information about Vaccination in India.
source.ae1072bc:
#Covid: 20% of doses in Chennai were in Teynampet, Royapuram zones.

"Of the 24.82 lakh vaccines administered till Monday evening, 2.8 lakh were given in Teynampet and 2.8 lakh in Royapuram, the two zones together accounting for around 23% of the total, corporation data shows. Anna Nagar comes third with 2.6 lakh doses administered, while Kodambakkam comes fourth with 2.5 lakh doses."

"A corporation official said that hesitancy about getting vaccinated had gradually decreased among people, especially among the younger lot. Focused drives for providing second dose of Covaxin was also based on feedback from the ground, the official said. From less than 2,000 people getting their second doses every day, the corporation was able to reach around 6,600 people in a single day last week, he said."

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/chennai/covid-20-of-doses-in-chennai-were-in-teynampet-royapuram-zones/articleshow/83942491.cms
source.fc593168: #Let's try to reduce the Zoom to 6-8 following Varshini's recommendation.
source.19b079cf: #Private vaccination centers collect Fee for the vaccine. Probably, that's why we see 1145 in column Fee for Sputnik V (MIOT Hospitals).
source.ac32333a:
#Code that shows the number of first doses available in Teynampet.

"And the color factor is used for a categorical feature from the dataset to see differences. Now I've used the feature 'allow_all_age' which is categorical with classes true and false. So it'll display whether all ages are allowed in that particular vaccination centre at Teynampet."

"Size - numerical attribute to quantify"

"Color - categorical attribute to classify the data points on the map according to the class of that categorical attribute."

Explanations by Varshini PJ.
source.90c391ef: #After Teynampet's let's look in other Blocks in Chennai.
source.d89cf2d7: #Age column contains only 18> and 45> because the government prioritized people from this age group to get vaccinated first.
